summary: An FBI internal email update from August 9, 2019, providing a status report on the Jeffrey Epstein investigation. It covers asset forfeiture progress, victim identification, hotline tips, and efforts to interview co-conspirators, including one located in London.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the investigation; his LLC companies were subpoenaed and his New York residence is being appraised for forfeiture.

events.title: Appraisal of Epstein's NY Residence
events.description: A certified appraisal was completed for Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence, valuing it at $86,250,000.

events.title: FBI Investigation Status Update
events.description: The FBI provides an update on the Epstein investigation, reporting on victim interviews, co-conspirator contacts, and asset forfeiture proceedings.

keyFacts: Approximately 60 victims have been identified in the Epstein case, with potentially hundreds more unidentified; over 20 have been interviewed.
Victims reported being sexually abused at multiple Epstein residences in New York, Florida, Little St. James, and New Mexico.
A certified appraisal valued Epstein's New York residence at $86,250,000 as of July 13, 2019, and a notice of pendency was filed for it.
Multiple subpoenas have been served on Epstein's LLC companies, which are based in the U.S. Virgin Islands.
One co-conspirator resides in London; contact has been made with UK counterparts to arrange an interview, while another co-conspirator has been cooperative in meetings.
